10 years ago and to make sure that our regions are completely isolated and I

between your regions you're gonna have an outage that could potentially span globally so even though you think you've got you
know you're in multiple regions you're safe no regions gonna fail for the same reason at the same time if you sharing
any data between those regions there's a good chance that you could actually have a global outage so the view that AWS
takes which is quite different from what we've seen from the rest of the market is that we want this strong isolation and to provide you with tools such as
route 53 cloud front and other services that can layer on top of this layer of very strong isolation to give you the
